Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vase, possibly a kantharos; interior: glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of legs of nude male figure moving to right; part of palmette (with added red on left-hand leaf) on upper left and part of spiral on lower left; inscription between figure and palmette.
Curator's comments: Smith considers the style to be that of Nikosthenes, while for Beazley it recalls Nearchos (Smith 1888, 233, no. 3; Beazley, ABV, 347).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.3)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 474, no. B819)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0748) (Phase 1)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 690, no. 478)
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 233, no. 3)
